choices.D: User, because this stakeholder ensures that the project provides value for money.
choices.C: User, because this stakeholder may train its staff using the 'e-learning course'.
choices.A: Supplier, because this stakeholder provides the expertise required by the project.
choices.B: Supplier, because this stakeholder is an external supplier.

questions.question_text:
A construction company that is one of ABC Company's key clients has agreed to provide a member of the staff to review and comment on the 'e-learning course'.
Which stakeholder interest should the member of staff represent, and why?

comments.content: I now think C could probably be the correct choice.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D seems to be the most appropriate answer. 
However as per the Prince2 manual, it is executive who is responsible for the assessment of 'Value for Money' option which is contradictory to this.

The answer is C. User, because this stakeholder may train its staff using the ‘e-learning course’.

In this context, the construction company is a key client of ABC Company and will be using the ‘e-learning course’ to train its staff. Therefore, the member of staff they provide to review and comment on the course would represent the interests of the user. They would be able to provide valuable insights into how well the course meets their training needs and suggest improvements based on their experience as a potential user of the course. This feedback can help ensure that the course is effective and meets its intended objectives. So, in this scenario, the staff member represents the user stakeholder interest.

So for C, my understanding is that this key client could also later buying this product and could become again client for it so ABC can get the money which is the benefits, purely by having this construction staff saying okay to the course it is not sufficient to say this project would earn money. otherwise I'd think its D too?
I feel D is the answer

Selected Answer: B
B. Yes, because the course developer is likely to have the project management and specialist knowledge required.

The answer is B. Yes, because the course developer is likely to have the project management and specialist knowledge required.

The senior course developer’s experience with the standard course development model and previous project management experience under the same executive make them a strong candidate for the project manager role. Their specialist knowledge in cour

choices.C: No, because the course developer's team reports to the Business Development Director, not the Operations Director.
choices.D: No, because there is a conflict of interest as the Training Development Manager is responsible for gaining accreditation.
choices.B: Yes, because the course developer is likely to have the project management and specialist knowledge required.
choices.A: Yes, because the course developer is responsible for ensuring that trainers deliver courses to the required standard.

questions.question_text:
Use the 'Additional Information' in the Scenario Booklet to answer this question.
The Operations Director is the executive for the project and has proposed that a senior course developer be appointed as project manager. The course developer works in the Training Development Manager's team and has a good understanding of the standard course development model. The course developer was a team manager on a previous project for which the Operations Director was the executive.
Is this proposed appointment appropriate, and why?

choices.A: Yes, because the executive should be available to provide ad hoc direction to the project manager.
choices.D: No, because the project manager should be given authority to manage the project on a day-to-day basis.
choices.C: No, because the senior user should be responsible for specifying the quality criteria for the training materials.
choices.B: Yes, because the executive should be the key decision-maker on the project, supported by other project board members.

questions.question_text:
The 'classroom-based training materials' will be used as the basis for developing the 'e-learning course'. As a result, the executive wants to ensure that the
'classroom-based training materials' are of the required standard. The executive has asked to meet the project manager every day during stage 2 to discuss progress and identify any concerns regarding quality.
Is this an appropriate approach to applying the organization theme, and why?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agreed with the option D. Manage by exception principle gives project manager authority for day to day management of the project in all aspect.

The answer is D. No, because the project manager should be given authority to manage the project on a day-to-day basis.

While it’s important for the executive to be involved and informed about the project’s progress, daily meetings could be seen as micromanagement and may not be the most efficient use of either the executive’s or the project manager’s time.

questions.question_text:
ABC Company has a number of projects in progress. The executive of the Health and Safety Training Project is also a member of the project board for two other projects and is very busy. As a result, during this initiation stage, the executive has appointed another person to carry out both their business assurance and the role of change authority for minor and medium severity issues.
Is this appropriate, and why?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Refer 7.2.1.6 
Page 65
The project manager and/or the people with delegated project assurance responsibilities may act as the change authority.
The answer is A. Yes, because people with delegated project assurance roles may act as the change authority.

choices.D: No, because the project manager identifies the level of tailoring that is relevant for the project.
choices.B: Yes, because projects that are likely to have many changes should delegate the change authority.
choices.C: No, because the decision to have a change authority should be made before the project is authorized.
choices.A: Yes, because people with delegated project assurance roles may act as the change authority.

questions.question_text:
The development of the 'e-learning course' will be outsourced to an external supplier and their key members will join the project management team. The supplier wants to keep their work processes confidential and not share these with ABC Company. ABC Company has agreed.
Who should approve the external supplier's team plan?

discussion.content:
In PRINCE2, if the project management team includes key members from an external supplier, the approval of the supplier's team plan would typically be the responsibility of Corporate, Programme Management, or the Customer roles, depending on the specific governance structure of the organization and the project. These roles are responsible for overseeing the project at a higher level and ensuring that it aligns with organizational objectives and standards.

Therefore, the correct answer is:

D. Corporate, programme management or customer

Refer 18.4.1 
Seek necessary approval for the team plan (although in a commercial customer/supplier relationship it may be inappropriate for the project manager to review and approve the team plan and, in such a context, the senior supplier may review and approve the team plans).

The project manager reviews team plans for the internal project organization, but not third-party suppliers. Supplier assurance provides objective assessment, but does not approve team plans. Corporate/programme/customer are outside the project and would not approve team plans.
senior supplier is inhouse, would have conflict of interest with the external supplier, same with C. I think D makes sense?

Selected Answer: A
Senior Supplier. 
Corporate and program management is incorrect answer

18.4.1 Accept a work package

Seek necessary approval for the team plan (although in a commercial customer/supplier relationship it may be inappropriate for the project manager to review and approve the team plan and, in such a context, the senior supplier may review and approve the team plans).

A. Senior Supplier
